A Personal Memoir

Parrish, a Lecturer in the Department of Government at the University of Texas at Austin, received his Ph.D. in Political Science from Columbia University in 1993. His dissertation, entitled, “The USSR and the Security Dilemma: Explaining Soviet Self-Encirclement, 1945-85,” examines the political problem of the recurrent adoption of self-defeating aggressive grand strategies by the USSR during the years of the Cold War

note: version of a paper presented at the Conference on New Evidence on Cold War History, held in Moscow in January 1993 and sponsored by CWIHP.
title: International Research & Exchanges Board, and the Fund for Peace, he spent 1990-91 conducting archival and interview research in Moscow, and in January and February 1993 he returned to Moscow for further research with the generous assistance of the Cold War International History Project (CWIHP) and the Harriman Institute of Columbia University. He is currently working on a book based on his dissertation. This working paper is derived from one of the chapters of that manuscript, and is also a
